attributes.action: Change tier 4 rules to allow people in mental health hospital a visitor
attributes.additional_details: Being inpatient, for mental health reasons, we already feel alienated from society and many of us where holding onto Christmas relaxation of rules, even one day. I myself, being under section 3 can not go against medical advice and have spent the last 4 years in hospital with anorexia and BPD, also those not sectioned could then be sectioned should they try to leave to see a loved one. I for one was holding onto this period to see family and staff also hoped we could see even one person.
attributes.background: For patients in a mental health hospital as inpatients in tier 4 locations to have the same visitor rights as those in care homes. It is integral to recovery, many of us have been in lockdown since March and/or not even left the hospital grounds this year. Why are we different to care home residents

rejection.details:
Decisions about visitors to hospitals are a matter for the NHS, not the Government or House of Commons.

Under tier 4 restrictions, you can leave home to visit someone who is in a hospital: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/tier-4-stay-at-home
